original: Ericsson, Eric Theodor, leg. läkare, Göteborg, f. 26/9/02 i Lundby förs. i Gbg av agronom August Johan Ghristofer E. o. Selma Berta Lundgren. G. 32 m. med. lic. Greta Tessing. Barn: Signe f. 32, Margareta 41. — Stud:ex. i Gbg 21, med. kand. v. Ka-rol. inst. i Sthlm 24, med. lic. i Lund 31. Kort. vik. v. Lunds las. med. avd. 31 o. 32, vik. aman. v. patolog, inst. i Lund 32, e. läk. v. Lillhagens sjukh. 33-34, und :läk. v. Renströmska sjukh. 34, vik. und :läk. v. Sahlgr. sjukh. med. avd. 34-36, ord. undiläk. där 37 o. bitr. överläk. där sed. 46.
translated: Ericsson, Eric Theodor, qualified doctor, Gothenburg, born on 26/9/02 in Lundby parish, Gothenburg to agronomist August Johan Ghristofer E. and Selma Berta Lundgren. Married in 1932 to medical licentiate Greta Tessing. Children: Signe born in 1932, and Margareta born in 1941. Completed gymnasium (secondary school) in Gothenburg in 1921, attained medical degree from Karolinska Institute in Stockholm in 1924 and earned a medical license in Lund in 1931. Ericsson worked briefly as a relief doctor at Lund Hospital's medical department in 1931 and 1932, was a relief assistant at the pathology institute in Lund in 1932, a resident physician at the Lillhagen Hospital from 1933 to 1934, an assistant physician at Renströmska Hospital in 1934, and a relief assistant physician at Sahlgr. Hospital's medical department from 1934 to 1936 before becoming a regular assistant physician there in 1937 and eventually a deputy senior physician in 1946.
